info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 3:09PM EDT until July 09 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Albany County in east central New York... North central Greene County in east central New York... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 309 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Westerlo, or 14 miles southwest of Delmar, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Westerlo, Rensselaerville, Clarksville, Coeymans Hollow, Snyders Corners, Shoefelt Corners, South Westerlo, Dormansville, West Greenville, Alcove, Newrys, Keefers Corners, Smith Corner, South Berne, Reidsville, East Greenville, Bramans Corners, New Salem, Wolf Hill and Helderberg. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
